intro: Erigeron socorrensis, commonly known as the Socorro fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron socorrensis is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
